name: Alert360
0:
”Alexa, tell Alert Three Sixty to turn on the lights”
”Alexa, ask Alert Three Sixty to run sleep scene”
”Alexa, ask Alert Three Sixty to arm stay”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: alert three sixty
des:
Don’t want to get up from the middle of a movie but you’re not sure if you locked the front door? Ask Alert 360 to lock the front door. A little hot or too cold, ask Alert 360 to set the living room to heat or AC mode. Want to get your property ready for bedtime? Ask Alert 360 to run your sleep scene. Whatever the scenario, the Alert 360 skill adds convenience to monitoring and controlling your system. 
Here are a few examples of other commands (start with “Alexa, ask Alert 360…”): 

Scenes
“…Sleep.”
“…run Sleep scene.”

Security
"...is my security system (dis)armed?" 
"...to arm stay my security system."
“…to disarm.”
“…arm partition 1 stay.”
“…arm stay with no entry delay.”

Access
"...if the garage door is open?"
"...to close the garage door."
"...is the front door unlocked?"
"...unlock the front door." 

Thermostat
"...what is the temperature?” 
"...to set the living room to AC mode."
"...to set the kitchen thermostat to 72 degrees."

Lights
"...to turn the kitchen light on."
"...to set the living room light to 20%."
"...to turn off the lights."

Is the skill having trouble picking up some of your devices? Try changing the name of your equipment to something more common or check your equipment name for spelling errors.
Before using this skill, you will need your Alert 360 username and password to link your Alert 360 account with Alexa. Please note that the Alert 360 skill only works for customers who have integrated systems powered by Alarm.com.
